website_summaries.verdict: Strong grip from a brand that knows the power of a racquet.
pros: Flexible in design, these gloves work well for not just racquetball, but tennis and pickle ball too
Responds well to hot temperatures and sweaty conditions
Silicone web palm pattern provides ultimate grip and durability
cons: Sticthing may come apart but customer service is first class

customer_reviews.title: pattern change
customer_reviews.text: Have you purchased this is the past? Well they have changed their pattern. Old pattern: no stitches on the inside thumb. New pattern: Stitches on the inside right where you grip onto your paddle or racket. So disappointing because a great many on my pickleball group use this glove and now won't. Hope they go back to the old pattern.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Effective, but quality concern.
customer_reviews.text: I play tennis and sweat profusely in SC summer matches. I have used many towels, rosin, grip-dry, beeswax, and even tried pine tar (don't bother). All these remedies have left my grip soaked after a couple of points and the racket spinning in my hand. This glove so far is the answer. It is a tad bulky at first, but it does not affect my ability to go semi-western, continental or backhand instantly. My one concern is that one of the seams has split a few stitches. That won't deter me from getting another though.
customer_reviews.author: P. T. Waite

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for tennis
customer_reviews.text: I use this for tennis, especially when there’s high humidity because... I’m a sweaty person! I get 95% of the feel of hoding a racket, without the blisters and loss of control that comes from sweaty palms and, resultingly, overgrip. - wash easily - don’t smell (yet) - have a nice tackiness to them - tackiness is especially helpful when my overgrip becomes slick mid-match — I put this glove on and all is well
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted.  Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I play a great deal of pickleball, and I sweat profusely. My hands would always slip on the racquet after a few games. This glove has solved the problem perfectly. One of the few things that is exactly as advertised. One possible oddity is the reason for the missing star: Do Not Wash. Do not wash? It's something you perspire into. Rinse? Do Not MACHINE Wash? Hand wash only? But Do Not Wash? Woolite in the sink, I think. Sizing: I have big hands and always order XL. These were actually felt a little big in XL. I tried the L and it's a bit tight. Neither is awful, neither is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Martha's Vineyard

customer_reviews.title: Seeing only small leather fit-strap top-side, but good glove
customer_reviews.text: Actually happier if none or faux-leather, because more washable. Looks easily washable. Mostly breathable synthetics.. I like it. Very comfortable my first try. My hand is 3 1/4" across just under the fingers, and 7 1/4" from end of wrist to tip of middle finger. Any bigger then get a large, mine was Medium size. Bought because hand always sweats and feels wet on pickleball bat handle/grip, feels like it could slip tho usually doesn't. With this glove i felt no sweat entire 2 hr session, was very impressed, comfortable, and didn't compromise my "dinking" control at all, another surprise. I'm sold on it after one use... more time to fully assess, but seems very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Milwaukie guy

customer_reviews.title: Glove work very well and is breathable
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the glove a few times since purchasing it.. I use the glove for Pickleball. The glove fits very well, is comfortable and gives me a good grip on the racquet. In fact. it started raining while we were playing and I still had a good grip on the racquet. I cannot rate the durability since I have only used it a few times. I bought the same glove for my wife and she is very happy with hers. The warmth rating is irrelevant since I didn't buy the glove for warmth. I am playing Pickleball in south Florida. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: FIts great - flexible, not stiff - velcro closes easily
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, lost the original, had to buy a replacement. I am a recreational player and required a simple glove that fit and didn't make my hand sweat. This glove fits the bill. Breathable, fits well and light weight. Def recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jay B

customer_reviews.title: Nice glove for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: This is a great replacement for the Head Air-Flow glove I usually get. Rubber palm is very grippy, but not hot. I don't feel sweaty in this glove any more than usual. Price is cheaper too, so that's another plus when you go through as many gloves as I do a year.
customer_reviews.author: B R J

customer_reviews.title: No more slipping paddle
customer_reviews.text: "Rubberized" palm had a different feel than i was used to...but very easy to get accustomed to. I play in Hawaii so the perspiration is abundant and drips down my arm onto my hand making the paddle slip. This glove solves the problem. I fully expect to wear the palm out in a few weeks but it is definitely worth buying a new glove every few weeks or so.
customer_reviews.author: Pickleball Al

customer_reviews.title: cant ask for more
customer_reviews.text: been using a pair of these for past 9 months. i play handball (some may know it as wallball) 3-4 days a week and paddleball on sunday. gloves are holding up fine but are showing a little wear. very light and i dont even feel like i am wearing anything. i normally wore baseball batting gloves but went to these cause a buddy had them and i liked the grip texture on palm side to control ball more. i dont notice grip slip with paddle unless i loosen up which is my fault.
customer_reviews.author: JT Miller

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Hockey Goalie Glove use to prevent slipping
customer_reviews.text: Had issues with a couple of my catchers getting slippery when sweaty and loosing grip later in a skate session. Too the point I was going to sell two of my catchers. Now, just with the help of this glove which is soooo light you don't even know you are wearing it I did not sell either glove and one is now my favorite with this glove. I purchased a second just to make I always have a backup on hand. Not sure how these work for Racquetball but for a hockey goalie with glove slipping issues they are purer GOLD!!!! What a cheap fix!
customer_reviews.author: Your Part Source

customer_reviews.title: Great for overcoming sweaty hand playing Tennis
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through a progression through baseball batting glove, golf glove and now this HEAD Racquetball Glove. This glove has more of a web mesh covering with silicon pattern to improve grip. It seems to hold up to washing. I don't put it in the dryer. Even soaking wet, the silicon surface pattern enables me to have good grip on my raquet. Unlike a leather golf glove, this glove doesn't dry into a shrunken grip. It is easy to put on, take off and has met my need for a good grip tennis glove.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit, DOESN’T LAST.
customer_reviews.text: Day 1: Bought this glove for pickleball. Large fits snug but not too tight. Feels like almost nothing on my hand. It wicks moisture away too. Day 2: Downgraded to one star. A seam is coming apart on this glove after having played about ten games. Going to seek a return and never buy a Head glove again.
customer_reviews.author: KRT

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove
customer_reviews.text: I had this glove for about 5 years playing raquetball. This past week it ripped on me. Bought a new one and I am using the glove now to play pickleball and its great. Fits nicely, my hand does not sweat with the glove on. Like the feel of it.
customer_reviews.author: The Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Zero grip for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I sweat like crazy during pickleball. I use an overwrap on grip. I tried the other type head glove...they get super wet so I bought two and rotate them every game. Problem is that they rip to easily....so I bought this model. Problem with this glove is that they grip is terrible.....like Teflon. So I also needed to buy a tacky towel....that helps immensely
customer_reviews.author: Steven O.

customer_reviews.title: Great tennis glove too!
customer_reviews.text: It's marketed as a racquetball glove but this can be used for tennis. I see a lot of my tennis friends with them. One thing I like is that the glove has ridges in it so as to add more of a grip. It helps keep the racquet from slipping out of my hand. My hands are sweaty in the summer so this really helps.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: good grip, poor shock absorption (racquetball)
customer_reviews.text: I have tendinitis and wear a sleeve while playing racquetball. my previous glove was great but wore out so i bought this one because i thought they're all the same. pros: -cheap -great grip cons: -poor shock absorption - terrible pain in my elbow after 1 game overall its ok but when this one wears out i'll spend a few bucks more and buy a better one
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good until it gets sweaty.
customer_reviews.text: This glove feels good when it is dry. But I should be in this work, it stretches and becomes less effective as the racket can slip in your hand on contact. Again, very nice glove when it is dry, when you’re sweating it is no longer. Unfortunately, your sweat a ton and Racquetball. With that, the glove does not work effectively very long.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel D.

customer_reviews.title: Great glove, best value in gloves I've found
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get used to vs leather but now my favorite glove and I have a ton of them. I do change gloves every game as these do get more slippery than traditional leather gloves, but they also don't get as nasty and stiff over time. I've yet to have one wear out.
customer_reviews.author: PH

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove, and after the third use, the stitching started coming out in the ring finger. I returned it hoping it was a fluke, but after using the replacement glove just one time, the stitching started coming out of the ring finger. I also developed a blister on the palm of my hand for the first time ever while playing racquetball when using this glove. Disappointed to say the least!
customer_reviews.author: J. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Long Lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this glove dozens of times for both pickleball and racquetball. I wear it 1-3 hours at a time and it looks and feels like it did on the first day. I hand rinse and air dry as needed. The Velcro closure sticks well and I would highly recommend this glove.
customer_reviews.author: BlackHawk

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle grip
customer_reviews.text: Bought this glove for use in playing pickleball. Hand holding the paddle tends to sweat and this adversely affects my grip on the paddle This glove has solved the problem, provides very good grip Glove also looks stylish, which is an added plus.
customer_reviews.author: George Mosby

customer_reviews.title: Quality Glove That Provides a Great Grip on a Racket!
customer_reviews.text: As a tennis player that sweats a lot this glove has been a game changer in the hot, humid weather of Atlanta. I can grip the racket better than ever and still have great feel. The glove is very comfortable and well ventilated. I will say that after a few weeks some of the thin black silicon palm moldings have started to come of slowly, but the glove still performs great. Having played golf for many years I know golf gloves don't last a long time (especially in hot, humid weather) and I don't expect anything different from a racquetball glove, maybe 2 -3 months. Well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephjam63

customer_reviews.title: Fit & Grip
customer_reviews.text: These are just stretchy enough that a medium size fits nicely on my (usually) large hand. The silicon bead material grips more than leather; if you constantly switch between backhand and forehand grips (as I do) you may find leather more suitable. These support a power game well; a finesse game no so well.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: ... this glove for a long time and it works great. I recently bought 3 from PNC sports
customer_reviews.text: I have used this glove for a long time and it works great. I recently bought 3 from PNC sports. One glove, after 2 uses ,the stitching on the side of the little finger came apart. I contacted PNC thru Amazon and they never returned my email request. I was told I was outside of the 30 day window. Very poor customer service from PNC. I contacted Head and they have a 6 month guarantee and they are happy to replace it. This is the service I would expect from the seller as well. I will not buy anything from PNC again.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Poss

customer_reviews.title: Excellent glove for gripping a paddle
customer_reviews.text: My hands sweat a lot while playing outside and becoming slippery to grip a paddle. I’m not sure how much the glove could help and also worried the material might be too thick to take the space of my small hand. It’s amazing!! I played Pickleball for 3 hours without wetting my hand. The material is thin, stretch, and very comfortable to wear. It looks durable but I couldn’t tell by just using few days. I instantly felt it enhance my gripping power. I want to order for my left hand but they are out of stock on small. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Beau Bo

customer_reviews.title: Protects, but already ripped
customer_reviews.text: My husband plays aggressively. So not sure if he’s too rough, or if the glove is not durable. The seems have ripped by thumb are and need to be sewn in less than a month of use. My husband plays pickle ball at least 3-5 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: abdullah altayeh

customer_reviews.title: Great Glove for Sweaty Hands
customer_reviews.text: Play competitive doubles tennis in SWFL and finally found a glove that doesn't bleed ( dye ) color on to your hand, very comfortable and has great gripping with no slippage. I ordered a second to alternate gloves as I play 4 times a week.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesBuckeye

customer_reviews.title: Love this glove!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my college kid who has taken up the game of Racquetball. Since we are new to the sport we were not sure what we were getting. It was obvious after using this glove a few times that the head brand was a great choice. The construction is solid and provides the perfect amount of grip performance. It also seems to do a better job of minimizing the amount of sweat that builds up in the glove. Seems that dry quickly with minimal smell. The glove held up much better than the others that he has had before. We will always choose the head brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa W.

customer_reviews.title: great grip
customer_reviews.text: After getting this glove for pickleball I was surprised to see how many other players were using the same glove. Fits me perfectly, easy to put on and my grip has never been better.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel Gali

customer_reviews.title: Grip Assist
customer_reviews.text: Best way to improve grip on tennis racket. Very few people use this glove for tennis,m but I find it helps absorb sweat and greatly improves hand grip on my tennis racket. Reduces racket twist during off-center hits. A glove lasts about a full season of 3 times a week tennis.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great glove with the right type of grip.
customer_reviews.text: These are nice gloves. I was using the old version of the Head Web glove for many years and this one works equally as well. I have found though that they work better with certain grips/grip tape on the racquet. These work well with leather type grips. If you have a rubber grip (like on Ektelon racquets), they tend to slip when the grip gets wet.
customer_reviews.author: GalacticG

customer_reviews.title: A great glove for the job!
customer_reviews.text: I love how it feels on my hand when I wear it to play tennis. The grip is just great with it! Hope it lasts. Have it for several weeks now and play tennis twice a week. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: elam

customer_reviews.title: Poor Grip When Sweaty
customer_reviews.text: I am a very sweaty person and these gloves fail to provide a good grip as soon as the get moist even with my racquets that have aftermarket rubber grips. The material and/or pattern are not effective for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Bertram

customer_reviews.title: Great to use while playing tennis on the hot humid summer days!
customer_reviews.text: Playing tennis in the summer in the south can be difficult, especially when trying to grip the racket. I don't have this problem any more after starting to use this glove.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Nygren

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slippery when sweaty!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely slippery when sweaty! Good grip when dry and good fit (as expected), which is the only reason it got 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: The glove is very nice. Bright colors and well sewn
customer_reviews.text: The glove is very nice. Bright colors and well sewn. I use it for golf and it does well .. Update about a year later.......These hold up very well....easily outlast typical $18+ prestige golf glove....and your unlikely to find a left handed mens largeish RB glove by head in regional brick and morter sport store so buy it here
customer_reviews.author: roythaboy

customer_reviews.title: No more sweaty grip!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn’t sure I would like a full glove for pickleball but this glove is comfortable and allows me a better grip while playing. I highly recommend this lightweight HEAD glove.
customer_reviews.author: Blue sky girl

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Love this glove. Fits perfectly. I got a MED and is true to size. Keeps my hand dry with enough ventilation and provides a good grip on my Pickleball paddle
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Great glove!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this glove for playing pickleball. It fit well and is good quality. I plan to buy in another color as well. The one I bought was red.
customer_reviews.author: BB in Vista

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic glove!!
customer_reviews.text: Best and longest lasting glove I've had yet. I've played over 600 Pickle Ball games. ALL stitching and sticky coating is still intact and working fine. Other gloves wore out much sooner. Will gladly reorder same glove as backup glove. Mac
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for pickleball
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, considering we're in a pandemic. Glove feels good and fits well -- I got a large and a medium might have been good, too, as the material stretches.
customer_reviews.author: Jakson

customer_reviews.title: love my gloves
customer_reviews.text: I really like these gloves they have a good grip on them. I wear a left an right hand because I switch hands. I use them for pickleball. They have a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: SKB

customer_reviews.title: Great glove for Pickleball in Florida.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have been using these gloves for nearly six years. Perfect glove for a sweaty paddle hand.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Krieghoff

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable racquetball gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are great racquetball gloves. They fit my hand perfectly for the size. They are very comfortable and flexible. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen  McCoy

customer_reviews.title: No padding at all!
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this glove yet but be aware there are no dive pads. In fact there isn't any padding at all. I may return this simply because of the wrong info!
customer_reviews.author: J. Mang

customer_reviews.title: This is a great glove for pickleball
customer_reviews.text: They last for about a season and a half but are such a good glove I don't mind getting a new one . I use the older one for practice. During the summer I play 5 or 6 days a week. Winter maybe 3 days a week.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Leech

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a good value. On time delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Too soon to rate durability, comfort and value. I bought these gloves for my wife for pickle ball. They look great. Shipping was right on time. She likes them so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Deee

customer_reviews.title: Help relieve pain in my thumb when playing
customer_reviews.text: Not sure i was going to be able to continue playing pickle ball,but this helped my thumb pain go away. Looks like good quality so I hope to use it for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Luksich

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but you may need to try on a few
customer_reviews.text: Quality glove. Good fit, but took trying on a few of them to find the best fit and stitching quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lazar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent glove.
customer_reviews.text: It fits well, and is comfortable. It's a little bit gaudy, but so be it - It serves its purpose. It keeps the sweat off the grip on my racquet. Only reason I don't give it five stars is because the black webbing on the palm doesn't improve the grip. It has this sort of plastic mesh on the palm and fingers. I expected that mesh to be rubbery and improve the grip, but it is smooth, and really doesn't offer any sort of help. All-in-all it's a good product, especially considering the price. Good buy for a casual player with sweaty hands.
customer_reviews.author: M. Riffle

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and grip
customer_reviews.text: I love this glove. The fit is great and the grippy material really gives me a sturdy grip. Haven't played racquetball in 20 years, my new sport is pickleball. When I used my old glove, it still fit great but it was a little tattered from so much use. Was afraid I wouldn't be able to find as good a glove anymore. I was so excited to see that Head still makes the glove. I'm female with a really small hand and Head honors women and makes a glove just for my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed that the glove was so poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Used this glove when I played racquetball for several used. Played pickleball with that same glove. Purchased the same glove and the glove ripped along a seam. Asking for refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Practical for pickleball or racquet sports
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. I use it for pickleball because my hands get rather sweaty. I have washed it in cold water a couple of times, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: AGrassini

customer_reviews.title: not the web glove with the sticky beads
customer_reviews.text: This is a redesign of an earlier web glove. The earlier glove I had seen in stores had little sticky beads on the palm and fingers but I was only able to find them in right hand models. I ordered this one thinking it was the same glove and was a bit disappointed to find out that it had little sticky tracery like a web (which makes more sense from the name). It sort of feels like the glove has a good grip on the racquet but it's sliding around on my hand. I recently picked up an amp pro which is my new favorite glove.
customer_reviews.author: Bobkat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Glove!
customer_reviews.text: I got the ExLarge, one for each hand since I am a switch up pickleball player. Used them for the first time yesterday and was very impressed with how well I was able to grip the paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great glove at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an excellent glove for racquet sports--look no further. There's no need to spend a fortune on other other options as this glove has suited me just fine playing many hours of pickleball. It allows for an excellent grip. Solves the problem of too much sweat during play (but is not too "tacky" as some gloves can be).
customer_reviews.author: M. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Best glove ever
customer_reviews.text: Iim 52yrs old, started playing 5 days a week now for that last year and have gone thru so many gloves. Does not matter if you spend more money or little money, all the gloves just tear and are mostly garbage. Most of the gloves I bought just didnt have a good grip. Then I seen these and gave it a try. All my buddies that I play with now own one and I am telling you, dont bother looking anywhere else. The grip is great, the best Ive had. Its very comfortable and I cannot believe I finally found a great glove to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Jody Windland

customer_reviews.title: Head Racquetball glove
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this glove for many years. When Sports Authority left our area, I could not find it. One of my tennis friends suggested I go online and I was thrilled that I found the exact glove. I use it for tennis not racquetball because my hand does not get sweaty.
customer_reviews.author: ArlyB

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS GLOVE! My hand gets very sweaty and my previous glove would stiffen on drying and that made for a lot of difficulty putting it on the next time I played. This one returns to its original soft condition on drying and feels very good on my hand. Not sure I would ever try another.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Gibson

customer_reviews.title: I really like this glove and have no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I really like this glove and have no complaints. I'll probably order more soon, since you can never have enough gloves to play in. I've noticed a lot of other rball players wearing this glove and based off that fact I'd say it's relatively liked. It looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits great
customer_reviews.text: Great glove. I use it in my kayak for paddling and holding fish. I have a glove for each hand.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I usually don’t leave any reviews at all but this one has got me! This glove gave me more blisters than I would have had without it! All of them are on stitches!! Hurts as hell! So poorly made!! Whoever made this item up for sure has nothing to do with racquetball!
customer_reviews.author: Omar I

customer_reviews.title: slightly over priced
customer_reviews.text: these are slightly over priced. but I needed them quickly. so, time to receive was the opportunity cost.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: A lot of my pickleball friends are using this glove and it works great......for a couple of games. The glove gets wet pretty easily from sweating and defeats the purpose of using a glove to avoid slipping. Though I am still using the glove, I had to buy another type to get through my hour and a half of playing without dropping my paddle.
customer_reviews.author: grmartin

customer_reviews.title: Works well for tennis
customer_reviews.text: I buy these regularly to use for tennis. They don't shrink, grip well, and have ventilation. Also for some reason, the racquetball glove is quite a bit cheaper than a very glove Head sells as a tennis glove.
customer_reviews.author: Rod of SATX

customer_reviews.title: Superior racquet/paddle glove
customer_reviews.text: Use exclusively for high level pickleball. Secures grip, breathes well, dries quickly and most importantly, VERY comfortable. Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence P Greenberg

customer_reviews.title: nice racquetball glove.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the same glove years ago. This is my second glove and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque May

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Great grip. Your hand won't swear as much. My friend and I play racquetball a couple of times a week, but neither of us is very good or interested in investing too much money into the sport. That said, I was looking for an affordable glove that felt right and didn't leave my hand too sweaty after a game. This one is exactly that. It's very breathable material keeps your hand from getting too sweaty. I have tried a few other gloves, but this one is definitely my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Tore within 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: Just wore this product four times and it developed a long tear right on the index finger. At first the quality seems legit - but I am very disappointed with its results. Not overused it any how - just wore it using 4 games for racquetball - and this is what happened. Not going to buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this glove!
customer_reviews.text: I use this glove to play Pickleball & it works great. I ordered the small women’s size & it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: Lasted long
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase and first one lasted over 3 years with regular use.
customer_reviews.author: RS_ mom

customer_reviews.title: Something that is perfect for my game
customer_reviews.text: Playing a lot of pickleball and using a wood handle the glove works really well... This is the secord one I bought.. Will buy again..
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good grip.
customer_reviews.text: The textured ribbing helps provide a good grip of the racket. Seems reasonably durable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Riley

customer_reviews.title: ruined the grip
customer_reviews.text: I have a sweaty palms and i ordered this gloved to improve my grip but instead it runied my racquet grip, the material of grip on racquet rubbed against the glove and made a mess of handle and it wasn't even comfortable holding racquet with this glove. I Just used this glove once, and now i dont have any plans to use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_User_H

customer_reviews.title: My hand sweats while playing tennis in FL summer.
customer_reviews.text: Like that I can gripe my tennis racket well. It has held up for 2 months while playing tennis 4x/ week.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy & Bill Tetz

customer_reviews.title: Great glove great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great racquetball glove. Took a little getting used to he NO slip grip. The leather gloves always still gave way some but this glove does not!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff.Smith2300

customer_reviews.title: Poor grip
customer_reviews.text: I have used this glove for racquetball for the past few weeks. Unfortunately, the grip surface (some kind of silicon webbing per the product description) is slippery when the glove gets wet from sweat, which happens a couple of games in. At that point, wearing this glove does not provide much benefit over not wearing one. A leather glove would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Maintain grip in high humidity
customer_reviews.text: In southwest Florida when the humidity is over 90%, it is hard to maintain a grip on the tennis racquet while sweating profusely. This glove is the answer. I bought it for my husband and he is very happy with the performance. He can maintain his grip. It has only been a few days, so I can not yet speak to the durability of the glove.
customer_reviews.author: Rambler

customer_reviews.title: Great to pickleball.
customer_reviews.text: Use the glove every day to play pickleball. Works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mihalski

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for sport use!
customer_reviews.text: This club is lightweight and comfortable. I bought it for pickleball and so far so good. I’ve only had at approximately a month. It washes and dries quickly.
customer_reviews.author: JLWS FL

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tennis glove
customer_reviews.text: Terrific tennis glove, easy to grip racquet...comfortable, high quality construction ... great price and fast delivery
customer_reviews.author: Dee Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great Pickleball Glove
customer_reviews.text: Use glove for pickleball and replace it about once a year. Comfortable, great grip and super fast shopping.
customer_reviews.author: Art Goldman

customer_reviews.title: My husband is happy with this glove
customer_reviews.text: My husband is happy with this glove. He plays pickleball 5 times a week and uses it all the time. It is well constructed and fits him good.
customer_reviews.author: cloghopper

customer_reviews.title: Great for tennis
customer_reviews.text: Seems like this is one of the good ones... no complaints
customer_reviews.author: DaMan

customer_reviews.title: great for pickleball
customer_reviews.text: This glove allows me to switch from a forehand grip to a backhand grip easily. I never notice I am wearing it. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Smart Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Firm grip on my racket
customer_reviews.text: Have a firm grip on my tennis racket. Too soon to comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: David Seligman

customer_reviews.title: No more sweaty hands for pickleball
customer_reviews.text: This glove worked great while playing pickleball. My hands didn't get sweaty at all and it was comfortable to wear. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great grips on paddles
customer_reviews.text: Use this glove for playing beach tennis in Florida. Keeps a good grip on paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my husband and for myself. We use everyday playing pickleball. I wash them often.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick dry and no leather to get stiff and funky; best on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the best glove on the market! It fits like a glove. The grips are the best. It seems to last a long time. Your hand can breathe thanks to the mesh top, and the material is quick dry with no leather to get funky. Highly recommended; I only wish I could find this glove in several colors in case I ever change out of my red racket :-)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Allen

customer_reviews.title: Quality glove with perfect grip
customer_reviews.text: I am using this glove for almost a year now and ordered a 2nd one now. This is perfect for squash and other racquet sports too. My hands sweat quite a bit during the game and this glove plays its role perfectly while maintaining the right feel for racquet grip. The mesh structure offers good air flow. The good part is - it also dries very quickly and ready for use again within a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mayank Singhal

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The glove split the second time I wore it. The fit was ok, maybe slightly big on my hand but was shocked that it had a split on the inside of index finger on the seam . Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia P Godbolt

customer_reviews.title: Racquetball Glove
customer_reviews.text: This glove is good until the black rubber strips wears, but still usable.
customer_reviews.author: Ferdinand Caraballo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: We use this glove for hot days pickleball..
customer_reviews.text: Out here in the desert the glove is an advantage for pickleball. This glove works well and keeps the slippage to a minimum.
customer_reviews.author: gee

customer_reviews.title: Good Pickle Ball Glove
customer_reviews.text: I play pickle ball 6 times per week for about 2 hours each time. I purchased two of these gloves over a year ago and alternate using them each time I play and hand wash after each use. The gloves still look near new. They keep the paddle from slipping and help keep paddle face in correct position. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Morin

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Glove
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good and snug. Wears well. Grip is great. Been using for years for both racquetball and pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: Detail Handling

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, awful durability!
customer_reviews.text: I got nothing bad to say about comfort and how it feels. Thats overstanding. But, about durability its another story. It ripped after only first use. First day and thats it. I though in order a bigger size, and it was same thing. Too bad because like I said. They feel great!
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Great pickleball glove
customer_reviews.text: I wear this glove for pickleball. I love he way it grips to my handle. I ordered online because I have trouble finding left handed gloves in retail stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie and Bob

customer_reviews.title: High quality at a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: This glove is the second one I have purchased. I feel the glove is of excellent quality, fits perfectly and is fairly priced.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin T. Banes

product_meta.title: HEAD Leather Racquetball Glove - Web Extra Grip Breathable Glove for Right & Left Hand
product_meta.description: About the Glove: Take the court by storm with HEAD Web, a racquetball glove loaded with premium features all at a reasonable price. Made of a durable synthetic leather for lightweight comfort and finished with silicone webbing across the palm and fingers for ultimate grip right where you need it. The glove is finished with a high performance Cool Tech Spandex material that maximizes air circulation and cooling. Features:• Dive pads offer added protection and durability.• Available in multiple sizes for both left & right handed players. HEAD: Born out of engineering a better way to ski and play tennis, we have used the most modern techniques available to improve athletic equipment for decades. Now, we have turned that same vision and attention to detail to all racquet sports to bring you nothing but the best sports equipment & workout apparel available.
feature_bullets: HEAD PERFORMANCE: Born out of revolutionizing how we ski and play tennis, HEAD has constantly pushed athletic equipment into the modern era. Pairing decades of experience with modern tech; HEAD offers nothing but the best racquetball equipment available.
DURABLE DESIGN: Made of tough synthetic leather for lightweight comfort and dynamic flexibility.
UNMATCHED GRIP: Silicone webbing is fitted across the palm and fingers for ultimate grip where you need it most.
COOL TECH SPANDEX: High performance ventilated spandex fabric provides circulation, cooling & comfort to help you stay at peak performance levels.
KNUCKLE PROTECTION: Don't be afraid of those dive shots. Added padding on the knuckles keeps your hands fully protected.
